title: S008: Daily Cost Fact Table
description:
## Business Need

The pipeline currently computes a daily cost summary (cost per service per day) but does not persist it. Business users and downstream analytics cannot query historical daily cost data without re-running the entire pipeline.

A persisted daily cost fact table is needed so that:
- Cost analysts can query daily spend by service without re-processing source data
- Trend dashboards can show day-over-day and week-over-week cost movements
- Anomaly detection can reference historical baselines reliably

The fact table must reference the existing service dimension to enable drill-down by service category.

## Acceptance Criteria

AC-1: Daily cost records are persisted in the database, queryable by date and service.
AC-2: Each fact record is linked to the service dimension via a foreign key relationship.
AC-3: Re-running the pipeline for the same date range does not create duplicate records (idempotent).
AC-4: NULL or missing cost values in source data are handled consistently (coalesced to zero with an audit trail).
AC-5: The fact table is loadable from the existing pipeline entry points with no manual steps.
AC-6: All monetary values use consistent precision (two decimal places).
AC-7: A record count per day-service grain is preserved for reconciliation back to source data.

## Controls

- C-06 (Data Quality): NULL handling, type casting, reconciliation counts
- C-07 (Reproducibility): Deterministic output from same inputs
- C-08 (Idempotency): Re-run safety, no duplicate records

## Test Taxonomy

- t1_logic: Aggregation correctness, NULL coalescing, precision
- t2_contract: Schema validation, foreign key integrity to dim_service
- t3_quality: Data quality checks (no NULLs in required fields, valid date ranges)
- t5_idempotency: Re-run produces identical results, no duplicates
- t8_integration: End-to-end load from raw CUR through to queryable fact table

## Dependencies

- Depends on: dim_service (Sprint 2 — delivered)
- Depends on: raw_cur extract layer (Sprint 1 — delivered)

- Finance can report cost-to-serve per customer segment (premium, standard, enterprise)

- Margin analysis can compare revenue per customer against their infrastructure cost

AC-6: The fact table supports aggregation by customer segment for finance reporting.
AC-7: PII controls are maintained — the fact table references customer surrogate keys, never raw PII.

- C-06 (Data Quality): NULL handling, type casting, referential integrity
- C-07 (Reproducibility): Deterministic output from same inputs
- C-08 (Idempotency): Re-run safety, no duplicate records

- t1_logic: Cost attribution correctness, SCD2 temporal join logic, NULL coalescing

- t3_quality: Data quality checks (no orphaned foreign keys, no NULLs in required fields, valid date ranges)
- t4_access: PII controls — verify no raw email/phone leaks into fact table
- t5_idempotency: Re-run produces identical results, no duplicates
- t8_integration: End-to-end load from raw CUR and customer snapshots through to queryable fact table

- Usage type (e.g. RunInstances)

- [ ] AC4: Service category correctly derived from product code
- [ ] AC5: Idempotent — running the load twice produces the same result
- [ ] AC6: Works on local dev environment with production-compatible SQL

PROCESS GAP IDENTIFIED: [PO] QA Agent role lacks independent UAT capability

Current state: QA Agent re-runs Dev's unit tests and maps them to ACs. This is test coordination/reporting, not independent quality assurance.

Gap: No User Acceptance Testing (UAT) exists in the current ASOM workflow. UAT should:
1. Write independent test cases derived from ACs (not from reading Dev's code)
2. Test edge cases the Dev didn't consider
3. Verify system behaviour from the business perspective, not the implementation perspective
4. Be performed by someone/something that hasn't seen the source code

Root cause: The QA Agent and Dev Agent share the same LLM context — QA has already seen the implementation, so it cannot provide independent validation. This undermines C-02 (Separation of Duties) for testing.

Impact: The "QA Execution Report" currently provides verification theatre — it confirms Dev's tests pass, but adds no independent assurance.

Action: Raise as framework improvement — define UAT as a distinct activity from QA test coordination. Options:
  a) Human UAT tester writes acceptance tests independently
  b) Separate agent session with only story ACs visible (not source code)
  c) QA Agent writes its own test cases from ACs before reviewing Dev's tests

Raised for Sprint 2 retrospective.
